issue.title: Interop prep
issue.body:
- Support BLS, run and pass BLS-required tests
- Switch to SIMD SHA-256
- Update ZSSZ dependency
- embed configuration instead of using the previous configs fork
- update to v0.8.3

- update to v0.8.3

issue.title: V082
issue.body:
Big update, now up to date with the [v0.8.2 spec](https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-spec-tests/releases/tag/v0.8.2).

Changes:
- Big refactor:
  - Support all pre-computation types of epoch data.
  - Fully compositional, great for merging in phase1 and light client functionality later.
  - Re-organized to isolate features.
  - Design towards support for later Eth 2.0 phases.
- Testing changes:
  - Updated test runners for new tests
  - Demo run in `example/demo` folder.
  - Benchmarking of SSZ.

issue.title: V082
issue.body:
Big update, now up to date with the [v0.8.2 spec](https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-spec-tests/releases/tag/v0.8.2).

Changes:
- Big refactor:
  - Support all pre-computation types of epoch data.
  - Fully compositional, great for merging in phase1 and light client functionality later.
  - Re-organized to isolate features.
  - Design towards support for later Eth 2.0 phases.
- Testing changes:
  - Updated test runners for new tests
  - Demo run in `example/demo` folder.
  - Benchmarking of SSZ.

issue.title: Minor comments
issue.body:
1. Soon we should be using 4-byte fork versions everywhere (see [this commit](https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/964/files)) without the need to convert back and forth to uint32, so fork.go can probably go. Since the `GENESIS_FORK_VERSION` is 4 zero bytes, there's no need to even define the constant.
2. `GetEmptyBlock` and `GetTemporaryBlockHeader` are now gone. I would then put the containers in `block.go` into `containers.go` because they are containers.
3. Run https://github.com/mvdan/gofumpt, for example to fix some empty lines at the start of functions.
4. Run https://github.com/golangci/golangci-lint to automatically find bugs 🎉 
5. Is `utils/hex/` part of consensus? If so, can it go away?
6. I'm tempted to merge all the files in the `transition/` folder. All four files fit in 100 lines, and that way we can get a birds-eye view of all the transition logic in one file. You can then remove the folder and move `transition.py` one directory up.

issue.title: Repo tooling
issue.body: Code quality improvements, some small bugfixes, and configuration.

issue.title: get_beacon_proposer_index vs GetBeaconProposerIndex different comparison
issue.body:
PySpec:

```python
if effective_balance * MAX_RANDOM_BYTE >= MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE * random_byte:
```

(greater-than-or-equal)

zrnt:

```go
if effectiveBalance*0xff > MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE*Gwei(randomByte) {
```

(greater-than)

issue.title: ValidatorSet.Intersect index out of range
issue.body:
```go
package main

import "github.com/protolambda/zrnt/eth2/core"

func main() {
    var vs1 core.ValidatorSet
    var vs2 core.ValidatorSet
    vs1 = append(vs1, 4019120956461496119)
    vs2 = append(vs2, 3978709506094217015)
    vs1.Intersects(vs2)
}
```

issue.title: ValidatorSet.Intersect hang
issue.body:
```go
package main

import "github.com/protolambda/zrnt/eth2/core"

func main() {
var vs1 core.ValidatorSet
var vs2 core.ValidatorSet
vs1 = append(vs1, 1)
vs2 = append(vs2, 2)
vs1.Intersects(vs2)
}
```

issue.title: Flaw in transfer
issue.body:
This may totally be a false positive, not sure. However, in `block_transfer.go`

>  Verify that we have enough ETH to send, and that after the transfer the balance will be either 
> exactly zero or at least MIN_DEPOSIT_AMOUNT

I think that can be violated. If I have `transfer.Amount + transfer.Fee` on account `A`, and transfer `transfer.Amount` (let's say `1`) to `B`, then I should have `0` remaining. However, If `A`==`B`, then that will leave `A` with `1`, after `state.IncreaseBalance(transfer.Recipient, transfer.Amount)`. 

Not sure if that's checked anywhere else?

issue.title: Suggested re-structuring
issue.body:
1) Don't have a separate folder for `genesis` (it only has one file in it, namely `genesis.go`
2) Remove `enc_helpers.go` from `eth2/beacon/` because it's not part of the state transition function.
3) Put `deltas_computation` inside of `epoch_processing`
4) Remove `debug_format` outside of `eth2/util/`. Similar for `deltas.go` maybe.
5) `helpers.go` only has a single small function (`FindInAndOutValidators`). Can it be put elsewhere?
